name: Emerilâ€™s Stromboli
ingredients: 1/2 lb. hot Italian sausage, removed from casing and crumbled
1/2 cups thin sliced red and green peppers
instructions: In a skillet cook the sausage over medium high heat until browned and the fat is rendered, about 5 minutes.
Discard all but 1 T. fat from pan.
Add the onions, bell peppers, and jalapenos and cook, stirring until very soft 4-5 minutes.
Add the garlic and Italian seasoning and cook, stirring for 1 minute.
Make a pizza dough (or buy) or use frozen, thawed bread.
Roll dough out to 10 x 14 inches.
Overlapping slightly, layer half of the ham, pepperoni, olives, provolone and mozzarella over the top.
Using a pastry brush, paint the border of 1 long edge with egg wash.
Starting at the opposite long end without egg wash, roll up the dough into a cylinder, pinching the edges to seal.
Place on a baking sheet and repeat with the remaining ingredients.
Brush top of each with egg wash.
Bake until golden brown and crisp about 20 minutes.
Sprinkle with Parmesan and cook until cheese is melted about 5 minutes.
Emeril made his own dough, but you can do your own thing.
